intro: Poa iridifolia, commonly known as the silver hair grass, is a species of grass native to the alpine regions of South America. It is characterized by its slender, silver-blue foliage and dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations, often in mountainous areas. Its leaves are narrow and covered with fine, silky hairs that give it its distinctive appearance. Poa iridifolia is adapted to cold climates and is often found in alpine tundra ecosystems.
